item.title: You should write comments
item.description: Comments is one of these topics that we seem to never agree on (stackoverflow says so). I often hear that comments add noise to the code and that comments never get properly updated. The solution seems to be to properly self-document code. And I love Go for that; one of the Go proverbs even says: Clear is better than clever. It is true that Go favors easy-to-read code rather than smart-but-hard-to-parse code, which really helps keeping the level of comments low.
